intro: Sutera aurantiaca, commonly known as the golden sutera, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are tubular and clustered in racemes, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Sutera aurantiaca is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun.
